Class BubbleSortComparator<T extends Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
BubbleSortComparator<T>
public class BubbleSortComparator<T extends Comparable<T>> extends Object
This class is used to compare the performance of the three sorting algorithms: BubbleSortPassPerItem, BubbleSortUntilNoChange and BubbleSortWhileNeeded.

  • Constructor Details

    • BubbleSortComparator

      public BubbleSortComparator()

  • Method Details

    • measureBubbleSortPassPerItem

      public double measureBubbleSortPassPerItem(Sorter<T> sorter, T[] items, int numberOfTimes, int warmUp)
      Measure the time it takes to sort an array given a Sorter algorithm and an array. The method will run the algorithm a warmUp number of times to warm up the JVM and then run it again a numberOfTimes times to measure the time.
      Parameters:
      sorter - the sorter algorithm to use.
      items - the array to sort.
      numberOfTimes - the number of times to run the algorithm.
      warmUp - the number of times to run the algorithm before measuring the time.
      Returns:
      the average time it takes to sort the array.

    • compareWithInteger

      public static void compareWithInteger(int length, int numberOfTimes, int skipFirstN, String filename)
      The method creates 3 integer arrays (random, sorted, reverse sorted) and then measures the time it takes to sort the 3 arrays using 3 Sorting algorithms: 1. BubbleSortPassPerItem; 2. BubbleSortUntilNoChange; 3. BubbleSortWhileNeeded. The method will run the algorithms a warmUp number of times to warm up the JVM and then run them again a numberOfTimes times to measure the time. The results will be saved in a given CSV file.
      Parameters:
      length - the number of elements in each array.
      numberOfTimes - the number of times to run the algorithm.
      skipFirstN - the number of times to run the algorithm before measuring the time.
      filename - the name of the CSV file to save the results.

    • compareWithDouble

      public static void compareWithDouble(int length, int numberOfTimes, int skipFirstN, String filename)
      The method creates 3 arrays of doubles (random, sorted, reverse sorted) and then measures the time it takes to sort the 3 arrays using 3 Sorting algorithms: 1. BubbleSortPassPerItem; 2. BubbleSortUntilNoChange; 3. BubbleSortWhileNeeded. The method will run the algorithms a warmUp number of times to warm up the JVM and then run them again a numberOfTimes times to measure the time. The results will be saved in a given CSV file.
      Parameters:
      length - the number of elements in each array.
      numberOfTimes - the number of times to run the algorithm.
      skipFirstN - the number of times to run the algorithm before measuring the time.
      filename - the name of the CSV file to save the results.

    • compareWithString

      public static void compareWithString(int length, int numberOfTimes, int skipFirstN, String filename, int stringLength)
      The method creates 3 arrays of strings of a given length (random, sorted, reverse sorted) and then measures the time it takes to sort the 3 arrays using 3 Sorting algorithms: 1. BubbleSortPassPerItem; 2. BubbleSortUntilNoChange; 3. BubbleSortWhileNeeded. The method will run the algorithms a warmUp number of times to warm up the JVM and then run them again a numberOfTimes times to measure the time. The results will be saved in a given CSV file.
      Parameters:
      length - the number of elements in each array.
      numberOfTimes - the number of times to run the algorithm.
      skipFirstN - the number of times to run the algorithm before measuring the time.
      filename - the name of the CSV file to save the results.
      stringLength - the length of the strings in the array.

    • compareWithDummySmallObject

      public static void compareWithDummySmallObject(int length, int numberOfTimes, int skipFirstN, String filename)
      The method creates 3 arrays of DummySmallObjects (random, sorted, reverse sorted) and then measures the time it takes to sort the 3 arrays using 3 Sorting algorithms: 1. BubbleSortPassPerItem; 2. BubbleSortUntilNoChange; 3. BubbleSortWhileNeeded. The method will run the algorithms a warmUp number of times to warm up the JVM and then run them again a numberOfTimes times to measure the time. The results will be saved in a given CSV file.
      Parameters:
      length - the number of elements in each array.
      numberOfTimes - the number of times to run the algorithm.
      skipFirstN - the number of times to run the algorithm before measuring the time.
      filename - the name of the CSV file to save the results.

    • compareWithDummyLargeObject

      public static void compareWithDummyLargeObject(int length, int numberOfTimes, int skipFirstN, String filename)
      The method creates 3 arrays of DummyLargeObjects (random, sorted, reverse sorted) and then measures the time it takes to sort the 3 arrays using 3 Sorting algorithms: 1. BubbleSortPassPerItem; 2. BubbleSortUntilNoChange; 3. BubbleSortWhileNeeded. The method will run the algorithms a warmUp number of times to warm up the JVM and then run them again a numberOfTimes times to measure the time. The results will be saved in a given CSV file.
      Parameters:
      length - the number of elements in each array.
      numberOfTimes - the number of times to run the algorithm.
      skipFirstN - the number of times to run the algorithm before measuring the time.
      filename - the name of the CSV file to save the results.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method runs the sorting algorithms on different arrays of different sizes. The results are saved in a CSV file. The file path can be passed as a command line argument. If no file path is passed, the results will be saved in the file "./results.csv". The program will run the algorithms 100 number of times to warm up the JVM and then run them again a 1000 times to measure the time. The program will run the algorithms on arrays of size 100, 1000, 10000, 100000. The program will run the algorithms on arrays of type Integer, Double, String, DummySmallObject, DummyLargeObject. The program will run the algorithms on random, sorted and reverse sorted arrays.
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments.
